metadata.title: CVE-2018-12387 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
A vulnerability where the JavaScript JIT compiler inlinesArray.prototype.push with multiple arguments that results in the stackpointer being off by 8 bytes after a bailout. This leaks a memory addressto the calling function which can be used as part of an exploit inside thesandboxed content process. This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 60.2.2and Firefox < 62.0.3.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-12387` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 62.0.3+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
firefox-globalmenu - 62.0.3+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
firefox-mozsymbols - 62.0.3+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
firefox-testsuite - 62.0.3+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:60.4.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-globalmenu - 1:60.4.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:60.4.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:60.4.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-testsuite - 1:60.4.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:60.4.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:60.4.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:60.4.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '62.0.3+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2').
thunderbird package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:60.4.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
